message.content:
[Feasible]

T1531 - Account Access Removal

Method 1: Using the os module to delete user accounts
```python
import os

def delete_user_account(username):
    try:
        os.system(f"net user {username} /delete")
        return True
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Failed to delete user account: {e}")
        return False
```

Method 2: Using the subprocess module to delete user accounts
```python
import subprocess

def delete_user_account(username):
    try:
        subprocess.run(["net", "user", username, "/delete"], check=True)
        return True
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Failed to delete user account: {e}")
        return False
```

Method 3: Using the wmi module to delete user accounts
```python
import wmi

def delete_user_account(username):
    try:
        c = wmi.WMI()
        user = c.Win32_UserAccount(Name=username)
        user[0].Delete()
        return True
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Failed to delete user account: {e}")
        return False
```

Please note that all three methods require administrative privileges to delete user accounts. Also, be cautious when deleting user accounts as it may have unintended consequences.

To use this function, you can call it like this:
```python
delete_user_account("username")
```

Please replace "username" with the actual username you want to delete.

References:
1. os module: https://docs.python.org/3/library/os.html
2. subprocess module: https://docs.python.org/3/library/subprocess.html
3. wmi module: https://pypi.org/project/WMI/
